thread.title: Jose Mourinho: This Man United player can win Player of the Year
thread.title_full: Jose Mourinho: This Man United player can win Player of the Year

title: Jose Mourinho: This Man United player can win Player of the Year
text:
GETTY Zlatan Ibrahimovic has scored 24 goals in all competitions this season 
That is the view of Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho, who is managing the Swedish striker for the second time in his career. 
Ibrahimovic also played for the Old Trafford boss at Inter Milan. 
And Mourinho says of his 24-goal leading scorer: “He’s better now – he understands the game even better. 
“He has even more ambition and motivation to play at this level and he is an important guy for the young boys at the club. How much would Man United legends be worth in today’s transfer market? Wednesday, 22nd February 2017 MANCHESTER UNITED hero Wayne Rooney has been linked with a move to China, but how much would other legends be rated by Chinese clubs in their prime based on today's market? 1 / 16 How much would Man United legends be worth in today’s transfer market? “Could he be the player of the year? Yes” Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho 
“He is so very close to them in terms of trying to help and teach. I have got him in this period of his career and I think I am enjoying working with him even more than before. 
“Could he be the player of the year? Ithinkitwouldbeanamazing achievement – but yes.” 
That is a warning to Southampton ahead of today’s EFL Cup final at Wembley and Mourinho is relishing returning to one of his favourite stadiums. 
He said: “I first went to Wembley with Barcelona for the Champions League match against Arsenal as Mr. Van Gaal’s assistant. 
“The feeling was magnificent. I was there for the Euros when Gazza scored against Scotland – that was amazing. 
“And then I managed to go back for the first FA Cup final at the new Wembleywith Chelsea against Manchester United. 
“I’m sorry, I made United cry that day. But I always like to be back there, even for Community Shield games. I think it is an amazing stadium in which to play.” 
And Mourinho added, when asked whether Wayne Rooney would lift the trophy if United win it: “I don’t care who lifts it as long as we win. Related videos
